section.title: Verifiable Delay Function Mechanisms
section.t: The Proof of Process framework employs Verifiable Delay Functions (VDFs) to bind evidence to elapsed wall-clock time. A VDF is a function that requires a prescribed number of sequential computation steps to evaluate, but whose output can be efficiently verified.

section.title: Difficulty Calibration
section.t: The T_difficulty parameter MUST be calibrated to the Attester's hardware such that the VDF evaluation requires approximately the same wall-clock time as the evidence collection window. This calibration is performed during device enrollment and recorded in the device attestation certificate.
